CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The devices are structured as As shown in Figure 5a and Table 3 , the device that blended PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio had an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.76 V , a short - circuit current ( J SC ) of 4.4 mA cm^-2 , a fill factor ( FF ) of 47.5% and a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 1.6% . In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8% , respectively. In terms of PCE , approximately 56% was improved with 2.5% , compared with the device in which the PC61BM was applied as an acceptor. Because PC71BM is greater than PC61BM in terms of photon absorption at 400-500 nm , it was able to improve the PCE by increasing J SC . 6 The V oc of PQCDTB was greater than the widely known poly(3-hexylthiophene) , P3HT ( V oc = 0.5 - 0.6 V ). This type of result was obtained because PQCDTB ( -5.53 eV ) has a lower HOMO level than P3HT ( -4.9 eV ). 19,24 The value of FF for PQCDTB ( FF = 55.8% ) increased by 39% compared to PCZDTB ( FF = 40.1% ). The series resistance at PQCDTB and PC71BM ratios of 1 : 1 and 1 : 2 , as shown in Table 3 , was 31 and 27 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. In contrast , the series resistance at PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1 and 1 : 4 was 320 , 62 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. The series resistance of PQCDTB exhibited low value compared to that of PCZDTB. The decrease of series resistance could increase FF. PQCDTB showed high FF than PCZDTB due to decrease of series resistance by self - organization of quinacridone unit. 9 Figure 5b showed the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) data of the fabricated device. When PQCDTB was used as a donor and PC61BM and PC71BM were used as acceptors , the device had 38% and 41% EQE at 480 nm , respectively. The photovoltaic devices with PC71BM as an acceptor showed higher EQE values than those with PC61BM as an acceptor , although they absorbed photons in the same range of the solar spectra. This was because PC71BM has a stronger UV - vis absorption property than does PC61BM in the visible region , especially near 500 nm. 30 Hence , the PCE improved with an increase in J SC . In a device that used PCZDTB as a donor , an EQE of 48% was observed at 440 nm. Interestingly , λ max was blue - shifted by -30 nm because of the low π-π stacking and the weak intermolecular interaction of PCZDTB compared with PQCDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. PQCDTB (polyquinoxaline-quindimethylquindicarboquinone-di-terthiophene-benzothiadiazole)
2. PC61BM (poly[6,6-bis(3-hexylthiophene-2-yl)-2,5-thiophene]-3-thienylene-2,5-bis(3-hexylthiophene))
3. PC71BM (poly[6,6-bis(3-hexylthiophene-2-yl)-2,5-thiophene]-3-thienylene-2,5-bis(3-hexylthiophene)-co-[6,6-bis(3-hexylthiophene-2-yl)-2,5-thiophene]-4,4'-dithieno[3,2-b:2',3'-d]thiophene)
4. P3HT (poly(3-hexylthiophene))
5. PCZDTB (poly[2,6-(4,8-bis(5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b']dithiophene)-alt-3,6-di(thiophene-2-yl)benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b']dithiophene])

These are the Material Names mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PQCDTB
2. PC61BM
3. PC71BM
4. P3HT
5. PCZDTB

These are the Material Names mentioned in the paragraph that are relevant to the discussion about the devices and their properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PQCDTB (polyquinoxaline-quindimethylquindicarboquinone-di-terthiophene-benzothiadiazole) |
| PC61BM (poly[6,6-bis(3-hexylthiophene-2-yl)-2,5-thiophene]-3-thienylene-2,5-bis(3-hexylthiophene)) |
| PC71BM (poly[6,6-bis(3-hexylthiophene-2-yl)-2,5-thiophene]-3-thienylene-2,5-bis(3-hexylthiophene)-co-[6,6-bis(3-hexylthiophene-2-yl)-2,5-thiophene]-4,4'-dithieno[3,2-b:2',3'-d]thiophene) |
| P3HT (poly(3-hexylthiophene)) |
| PCZDTB (poly[2,6-(4,8-bis(5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b']dithiophene)-alt-3,6-di(thiophene-2-yl)benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b']dithiophene]) |

In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8% , respectively. In terms of PCE , approximately 56% was improved with 2.5% , compared with the device in which the PC61BM was applied as an acceptor. This type of result was obtained because PQCDTB ( -5.53 eV ) has a lower HOMO level than P3HT ( -4.9 eV ). 19,24 The value of FF for PQCDTB ( FF = 55.8% ) increased by 39% compared to PCZDTB ( FF = 40.1% ). The series resistance at PQCDTB and PC71BM ratios of 1 : 1 and 1 : 2 , as shown in Table 3 , was 31 and 27 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. In contrast , the series resistance at PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1 and 1 : 4 was 320 , 62 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. The series resistance of PQCDTB exhibited low value compared to that of PCZDTB. When PQCDTB was used as a donor and PC61BM and PC71BM were used as acceptors , the device had 38% and 41% EQE at 480 nm , respectively. Let's think step by step.

1. Open-circuit voltage (VOC)
2. Short-circuit current (J SC)
3. Fill factor (FF)
4. Power conversion efficiency (PCE)
5. HOMO level (energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital)
6. Series resistance
7. External quantum efficiency (EQE)
8. EQE values
9. λ max (wavelength of maximum absorption)
10. π-π stacking
11. Intermolecular interaction.

These are the property names mentioned in the paragraph.

4. Power conversion efficiency (PCE)

These are the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph. Other entities like Figure 5a, Table 3, Figure 5b, EQE data, λ max, π-π stacking, and intermolecular interaction are not property names but rather contextual information or measurements related to the properties.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The devices are structured as As shown in Figure 5a and Table 3 , the device that blended PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio had an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.76 V , a short - circuit current ( J SC ) of 4.4 mA cm^-2 , a fill factor ( FF ) of 47.5% and a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 1.6% . In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8% , respectively. In terms of PCE , approximately 56% was improved with 2.5% , compared with the device in which the PC61BM was applied as an acceptor. Because PC71BM is greater than PC61BM in terms of photon absorption at 400-500 nm , it was able to improve the PCE by increasing J SC . 6 The V oc of PQCDTB was greater than the widely known poly(3-hexylthiophene) , P3HT ( V oc = 0.5 - 0.6 V ). This type of result was obtained because PQCDTB ( -5.53 eV ) has a lower HOMO level than P3HT ( -4.9 eV ). 19,24 The value of FF for PQCDTB ( FF = 55.8% ) increased by 39% compared to PCZDTB ( FF = 40.1% ). The series resistance at PQCDTB and PC71BM ratios of 1 : 1 and 1 : 2 , as shown in Table 3 , was 31 and 27 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. In contrast , the series resistance at PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1 and 1 : 4 was 320 , 62 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. The series resistance of PQCDTB exhibited low value compared to that of PCZDTB. The decrease of series resistance could increase FF. PQCDTB showed high FF than PCZDTB due to decrease of series resistance by self - organization of quinacridone unit. 9 Figure 5b showed the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) data of the fabricated device. When PQCDTB was used as a donor and PC61BM and PC71BM were used as acceptors , the device had 38% and 41% EQE at 480 nm , respectively. The photovoltaic devices with PC71BM as an acceptor showed higher EQE values than those with PC61BM as an acceptor , although they absorbed photons in the same range of the solar spectra. This was because PC71BM has a stronger UV - vis absorption property than does PC61BM in the visible region , especially near 500 nm. 30 Hence , the PCE improved with an increase in J SC . In a device that used PCZDTB as a donor , an EQE of 48% was observed at 440 nm. Interestingly , λ max was blue - shifted by -30 nm because of the low π-π stacking and the weak intermolecular interaction of PCZDTB compared with PQCDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. Open-circuit voltage (VOC):
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 0.76 V
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 0.79 V
- For the device with P3HT: VOC = 0.5 - 0.6 V

2. Short-circuit current (JSC):
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 4.4 mA cm^-2
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 5.6 mA cm^-2

3. Fill factor (FF):
- For PQCDTB: 55.8%
- For PCZDTB: 40.1%

4. Power conversion efficiency (PCE):
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 1.6%
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 2.16% (approximately 56% improvement)

5. Series resistance (ρ):
- For PQCDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1: 31 Ω / cm^2
- For PQCDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 2: 27 Ω / cm^2
- For PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1: 320 Ω / cm^2
- For PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 4: 62 Ω / cm^2

6. External quantum efficiency (EQE):
- For the device with PQCDTB as a donor and PC61BM as an acceptor: 38% and 41% at 480 nm, respectively
- For the device with PQCDTB as a donor and PC71BM as an acceptor: higher EQE values than those with PC61BM as an acceptor
- For the device with PCZDTB as a donor: 48% at 440 nm

7. Wavelength (λ):
- λ max was blue-shifted by -30 nm for the device with PCZDTB as a donor compared to PQCDTB.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Open-circuit voltage (VOC):
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 0.76 V
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 0.79 V
- For P3HT: VOC = 0.5 - 0.6 V

2. Short-circuit current (JSC):
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 4.4 mA cm^-2
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 5.6 mA cm^-2

3. Fill factor (FF):
- For PQCDTB: 55.8%
- For PCZDTB: 40.1%

4. Power conversion efficiency (PCE):
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 1.6%
- For the device with PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio: 2.16%

5. Series resistance (ρ):
- For PQCDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1: 31 Ω / cm^2
- For PQCDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 2: 27 Ω / cm^2
- For PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1: 320 Ω / cm^2
- For PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 4: 62 Ω / cm^2 (for PQCDTB)

6. External quantum efficiency (EQE):
- For the device with PQCDTB as a donor and PC61BM as an acceptor: 38% and 41% at 480 nm, respectively
- For the device with PQCDTB as a donor and PC71BM as an acceptor: higher EQE values than those with PC61BM as an acceptor
- For the device with PCZDTB as a donor: 48% at 440 nm

7. Wavelength (λ):
- λ max was blue-shifted by -30 nm for the device with PCZDTB as a donor compared to PQCDTB.
